results.title: In the shadow of Hollywood [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Sylvie Groulx, Eric Michel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: With its barrage of special effects, its new heroes and warrior myths, the American dream is not what it used to be. Aided by new trade strategies, Hollywood is tightening its stranglehold on the world’s screens, leaving no room for indigenous cultures. Disturbed by this one-sided war of images, the director consults filmmakers and other experts on both sides of the Atlantic. Agnieszka Holland, Arthur Penn, Alain Tanner, Bertrand Tavernier, Milos Forman and Denys Arcand ponder the fate of cinema in the era of globalization. Can auteur cinema with its personal vision, its expression of the collective identity, withstand the onslaught of American movies and their single-minded focus on entertainment? Includes interviews with Denys Arcand, Anne-Marie Bidaud, Luciana Castellina, Milos Forman, Claude Fournier, Agnieszka Holland, Marin Karmitz, Todd McCarthy, Jonathan Nossiter, Arthur Penn, Leslie Quinton, Roland Smith, Jean-Charles Tacchella, Alain Tanner, Bertrand Tavernier, Daniel Toscan du Plantier, Margarethe Von Trotta, Andrzej Wajda and Irwin Winkler. In English and French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Heritage of the uncommon man
results.creator_credit: Reid H Ray and BNA Communications
results.brief_description: Joe Powell, a noted lecturer to businessmen, expounds his notions of the “Uncommon man” - the man who gets results. In an entertaining lecture, Powell describes the attributes and behaviour of the successful executive. Uses cartoons to illustrate some points of the lecture.

results.title: Looking at plants
results.creator_credit: Jim Harris, John Bird and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Filmed in the Sherbrooke Forest Park, Australflora Nursery, Victoria, and shows glimpses of the plant and insect life which abound there. No narration, music only.

results.title: Apollo 10: around the moon
results.creator_credit: United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: The film shows various footage of Apollo 10’s travel around the moon including: the Command module filmed from the Lunar module; the far side of the moon; Command module over landing site No. 2; view from Lunar module sixty miles up; inside the Lunar module; Lunar module descent and much more.

results.title: Out
results.brief_description: Initially following the trajectory of a car which is taking ‘The Girl’ (Celia Ireland), out to a social function, this short film allows the viewer to be privy to the thought processes of what it means to go “out”. The girl ponders issues such as timing, kissing, a no sex policy, being interesting, making an impression, pit stops, and identifying the highlight of the evening. Cast also includes John Polson and Suzy Dougherty.

results.title: As a matter of fact: a film about abortion
results.creator_credit: Robyn Dryen, Susan Lambert, Creative Development Branch of Australian Film Commission, Womens Film Fund and Women's Health Resources Foundation
results.brief_description: A documentary about a feminist run abortion clinic. Counselling is shown to be an important part of the procedure, which is carried out using local anaesthetic and the vacuum aspiration method. We follow one woman through the termination of her pregnancy, and other women tell why they chose to have an abortion. The film ends with an animated section on the struggle for free, legalised abortion in Australia and information on what to do and where to go if you are pregnant.

results.title: The Adventures of Floss the Fairy and Riddley Robot: the letter Z runs away
results.brief_description: Written and produced by an Early Childhood teacher in Queensland, this tape is aimed at assisting young children in developing literacy and numeracy skills. The video is interactive, allowing young children to discover and learn through literacy and numeracy experiences, and the fantasy story encompasses songs that are supported by 3D visual effects, thus creating a fun learning environment that further develops confidence and success. Areas covered include; spatial and positional word vocabulary and relationships, numbers, the alphabet, fine motor movements, self esteem, music and movement. ‘The Adventures of Floss the Fairy and Riddley Robot’ will entertain and educate children aged 7 months to 7 years.

results.title: Game girls: Heathens
results.brief_description: This tape contains two short documentaries about the culture surrounding football. “Game girls” (directed by Miriam Cannell), follows the role of women in Australian football and the often silent but loudly significant role they have played. Rated PG. “Heathens” (directed by Megan Spencer), confirms that there are really passionate and vitriolic supporters out there as director Megan Spencer follows St Kilda supporters with names like Thommo and Chook. Watch out for the language, which is alot more colourful than the red white and black. Rated R, for reasons which become very apparent from the first five seconds.

results.title: Shelter
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Wallhead and Vagabond Motion Picture Film Production Unit
results.brief_description:
A disturbed young man, frightened by the threat of nuclear war, wanders the streets in search of safety.

The film was shot on the city streets of Perth, Western Australia.
